jobs.title: Executive Director, Therapeutics Marketing
jobs.description:
The Executive Director, Therapeutics Marketing is a seasoned marketing expert responsible for developing and implementing a clear, rationalized and aligned promotional strategy for DAXXIFY in CD that differentiates our brand, optimizes adoption, advances our value proposition towards increasingly personalized and digitally-enabled solutions, and develops underlying capabilities for strategic advantage and growth. This role defines a systematic engagement plan for priority customer segments (HCP, patient, and 3rd party payer audiences) that integrates and balances face-to-face vis-a-vis virtual/digital audience interactions aligned with customers’ individual preferences for interacting with industry, shapes omnichannel go-to-market priorities, ensures robust responsiveness to customer needs, and drives resource utilization efficiency.

To support and inform the strategy, the Executive Director develops an efficient portfolio of customer insights and analytics that

  • includes an understanding of how different strategic customer segments acquire information;
  • discovers the moments that matter most in the customer adoption journey;
  • defines the key milestones and pain points that impact DAXXIFY purchases.

In collaboration with key internal stakeholders, develops sustainable and effective data collection and synthesis capabilities that rapidly generate insights that optimize our ability to get the right message on the right target at the right time. As an expert on evolution of the biopharmaceutical - key customer interaction landscape, recommends processes and content that advances understanding and awareness of internal colleagues.

Works cross-functionally with key Therapeutics stakeholders to ensure an appropriate level of input is incorporated into marketing strategies and tactics, and that those plans are integrated with and aligned to the Therapeutics franchise strategy.

Serves as a core member of the Therapeutics leadership team, contributing to the development and execution of the group’s vision and influencing key decisions. Delivers performance vs. annual operating plans with planned resources. Plays a key role in attracting and retaining innovative, agile talent in own department as well as across the broader commercial platform. Represents Therapeutics in the context of conferences, partnerships, key customers, company leadership meetings, and interactions with the Board of Directors.

Reporting to: General Mgr, Therapeutics

Location: Hybrid from Nashville, TN; remote from other locations

Salary Range: $195,000 - $280,000

Responsibilities/Essential Duties:

  • Lead the development of successful marketing strategies and tactics including the incorporation of new forms of engagement/business models/data-driven decision-making where appropriate; can create/envision new possibilities and translate into concrete operational plans.
  • Operate effectively in a ‘roll up your sleeves’ entrepreneurial environment and become rapidly conversant with the company’s platforms, product(s), and markets.
  • A solid understanding of the healthcare ecosystem; has a point of view on the evolving business model, benchmarks, trends, and emerging commercial capabilities that drive competitive differentiation.
  • A strategic vision and commercial acumen, with the ability to bring a fresh approach and new thinking along with a continuous improvement mentality.
  • The agility to search and respond to drivers of change, challenge the status quo, turn data into insights, insights into actions, mobilize resources, and learn with an open mind.
  • Demonstrated leadership, highly collaborative, a persuasive communicator with a strong executive presence that inspires confidence, works well in matrixed environments, resilient.
  • Passionate about the company’s technologies and benefits to patients.
  • Honesty, integrity, and a demonstrated ability to earn trust from colleagues and customers

Basic Qualifications

  • Master’s degree & 8+ years of Marketing experience

OR

  • Bachelor’s degree & 10+ years of Marketing experience

Preferred Qualifications

  • Strong track record of commercial success in the biotechnology, pharmaceutical or medical device industries; including 8+ years brand management/marketing experience
  • 10+ years total commercial leadership experience
  • Experience with physician-administered therapeutics
  • Marketing/launch experience in neurology

Company Summary:

As a commercial-stage biotechnology company focused on innovative aesthetic and therapeutic offerings, Revance is setting the new standard for its clients through disruptive products, and for its employees through industry-leading benefits, which promote financial and physical well-being for all. It’s time to rethink everything you thought an employee experience could be.


What Revance invests in you:

  • Competitive Compensation including base salary, annual target bonus, and new hire equity
  • Flexible unlimited PTO, summer & winter shutdowns, and 12 weeks’ parental leave
  • Generous healthcare benefits (Company pays up to 90% of premiums for medical benefits), Employer HSA contribution, 401k match, ESPP program with 15% discount on RVNC stock, tuition reimbursement, wellness discounts and much more

This section of the job description is required by the American with Disability Act (ADA). The ADA requires that job descriptions reflect the physical and mental demands required to effectively perform the essential duties of the job. The ADA prohibits employers from discriminating against a “qualified individual with a disability” in all aspects of the employment relationship. A “qualified individual with a disability” is “an individual who meets the education, experience, skill, and other job-related requirements of a position held or desired, and who, with reasonable accommodation, can perform the essential functions of a specified job.”

We are an equal opportunity employer. We are a company where diverse backgrounds, experience and viewpoints are valued. Revance does not discriminate in practices or employment opportunities on the basis of an individual’s race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, age sex, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other prohibited category set forth in federal or state regulations.

jobs.title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
Company Description


Job Description

Join the team redefining how the world experiences design.

Hello, g'day, mabuhay, kia ora, 你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you're probably keen to find out what's on offer, so we'll get straight to the point.

Where and how you can work

Our flagship office is in Sydney, Australia, but we've made our way from down under, to a hub in San Francisco, which is now home to our US operations. We offer flexibility in how and where you work. We trust our Canvanauts to choose the balance that empowers them and their team to achieve their goals.

What you’d be doing in this role

As Canva scales change continues to be part of our DNA. But we like to think that's all part of the fun. So this will give you the flavour of the type of things you'll be working on when you start, but this will likely evolve.

At the moment, this role is focused on:

  • Go-to-Market Strategy: Develop and execute go-to-market strategies for new product launches, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.
  • Market Research & Analysis: Conduct customer, market, and competitive research to identify customer needs, market trends, and opportunities for growth.
  • Product Influence: Influence the product roadmap by providing market insights and feedback from customers to the product management team, ensuring that product development aligns with market demands and opportunities.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Product, Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success to ensure alignment across business goals
  • Messaging & Positioning: Own the development and maintenance of compelling messaging and positioning, ensuring consistency across all channels and materials.
  • Content Development: Lead / support the creation of high-impact marketing collateral, including white papers, case studies, product videos, webinars, and sales enablement tools.
  • Strategic Enablement: Work with Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success to ensure our internal teams are enabled and that content reaches the right audiences.

You're probably a match if

  • You have 5+ years of product marketing or solutions marketing experience. Note that because this is a senior role, prior direct experience is required.
  • You may have prior experience in business consulting, product management, or marketing, which is a plus but not a necessity.
  • You have demonstrated success in developing and executing GTM strategies for B2B SaaS products.
  • You possess exceptional communication skills, with the ability to translate technical features into benefits for a wide audience.
  • You can build strong cross-functional relationships with stakeholders.
  • You can understand and identify trends in the market, our competitors, and our user needs across multiple segments.
  • You can juggle multiple projects at once and have strong prioritization skills.
  • You have a growth mindset and are eager to learn and grow every day. Given that Canva is growing 130% YoY, you are someone who’s aware that you’ll be growing and trying new things every day, and you are comfortable with ambiguity and having to forge your own path.
  • You love creating customer value and solving problems!

About the team

The product marketing team is on a mission to empower our Canva community to achieve their goals through Canva’s world-class products and tools. We do this by helping bring our new products to market and drive continuous engagement and adoption across our array of existing products. We want every person to discover how Canva can help them on a daily basis whether through creating social graphics, building impactful presentations, educating our future generations or printing gifts for your friends, with Canva everyone can achieve their goals.

What's in it for you?

Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you'll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a range of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.

Here's a taste of what's on offer:

  • Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too
  • Health benefits plans to support you and your wellbeing
  • 401(k) retirement plan with company contribution
  • Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers
  • An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more
  • Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge and supports you personally

Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.

At Canva we value fairness, and we strive to provide competitive, market-informed compensation whilst ensuring internal equity within the team in each region. We make hiring decisions based on your skills, experience and our overall assessment of what we observed and learnt in the hiring process. The target salary range for this position is $149,000 - $230,000. When calculating offers, we make salary decisions based on market data and candidates' skills and experience.

Other stuff to know

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

We celebrate all types of skills and backgrounds at Canva so even if you don’t feel like your skills quite match what’s listed above - we still want to hear from you!

Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.



Qualifications


Additional Information

jobs.title: Senior Staff Regional Marketing Specialist
jobs.description:
Company Description

Renesas is one of the top global semiconductor companies in the world. We strive to develop a safer, healthier, greener, and smarter world, and our goal is to make every endpoint intelligent by offering product solutions in the automotive, industrial, infrastructure and IoT markets. Our robust product portfolio includes world-leading MCUs, SoCs, analog and power products, plus Winning Combination solutions that curate these complementary products. We are a key supplier to the world’s leading manufacturers of electronics you rely on every day; you may not see our products, but they are all around you.



Job Description

We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Automotive MCU Marketing Staff Specialist to join our team and drive our market presence in the automotive industry in Europe.

Key responsibilities:

  • Develop and implement marketing strategies for automotive MCU products in Europe aligning with business objectives
  • Define product positioning and compelling messaging for target segments and customers
  • Lead efforts to secure design wins in collaboration with sales and FAEs. Build strong relationships with key customers and partners
  • Collaborate with engineering, sales, and product teams for effective marketing and successful product promotions
  • Provide sales teams with the necessary marketing tools and support to enhance their efforts and meet sales targets
  • Conduct market analysis, competitor research, and customer insights to identify growth opportunities and market trends
  • Represent the company at industry events and conferences
  • Monitor and analyze marketing performance metrics, providing regular reports and actionable insights to senior management



Qualifications
  • Strong knowledge of automotive MCU technologies, architectures, and applications, with a proven track record of successful marketing experience in this domain
  • Good understanding of Europe automotive markets (E/E architecture, ADAS, and Body), including market trends, customer needs, and regulatory requirements
  • Demonstrated ability to develop and execute effective marketing strategies that align with Europe automotive business objectives and drive market share growth
  • Strong collaboration skills to work closely with engineering, sales, and product teams to translate technical capabilities into compelling marketing messages
  • Proficiency in conducting market research, competitor analysis, and customer insights to identify opportunities and address market challenges effectively
  • Proven experience in positioning and differentiating automotive MCU products, understanding customer pain points, and communicating unique value propositions
  • Excellent communication and presentation abilities to effectively convey technical information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • A results-oriented mindset with a focus on achieving measurable marketing goals and objectives

    Requirements

    Bachelor’s degree in engineering or related fields and 5+ years of related professional experience. Master’s degree in Engineering, or BSEE with MBA with 3+ years of experience.



Additional Information

Renesas Electronics Corporation empowers a safer, smarter and more sustainable future where technology helps make our lives easier. The leading global provider of microcontrollers, Renesas combines our expertise in embedded processing, analog, power and connectivity to deliver complete semiconductor solutions. These Winning Combinations accelerate time to market for automotive, industrial, infrastructure and IoT applications, enabling billions of connected, intelligent devices that enhance the way people work and live. Learn more at www.renesas.com.

Renesas’ mission, To Make Our Lives Easier, is underpinned by our company culture, TAGIE. TAGIE stands for Transparent, Agile, Global, Innovative and Entrepreneurial. Our goal is to embed this unique culture in everything we do to succeed as a company and create trust with our diverse colleagues, customers and stakeholders.

Renesas Electronics is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, committed to supporting diversity and fostering a work environment free of discrimination on the basis of sex, race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, military status, veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. For more information, please read our Diversity & Inclusion Statement.

jobs.title: Director of Demand Generation
jobs.description:
The opportunity in front of us is massive. Our market is growing, fast. We’re a leader in our category. Our customer base is loaded with aspirational logos and vocal advocates, and our content attracts hundreds of thousands of visitors a month. If that gets you really f@*#ing excited, this post is for you.

Appcues is looking for a Director of Demand Generation to grab that opportunity by the horns and build a customer acquisition machine. We’re looking for a leader who craves ownership and obsesses over results. A data-driven, strategic operator with a move-fast, get-shit-done style of execution.

Appcues’ Director of Demand Generation will define the strategic vision for Appcues demand generation function,with direct responsibility for our lead conversion funnel and all paid and organic channels channels (existing and new ones you identify as potential growth drivers), managing a substantial budget, while continuously optimizing for CAC and LTV.


About the role
  • Own and manage to lead and pipeline targets in service of new business and expansion revenue targets. You’ll use every tool at your disposal to optimize conversion throughout the funnel, from reach to free trial starts and deal acceleration.
  • Manage strategy, execution, and optimization of all paid and organic demand generation programs including performance marketing, content, account-based marketing (ABM), conversion rate optimization, events (in-person and virtual), and sponsorships.
  • Manage a team of program specialists, external vendors, and budget to accomplish goals.
  • Establish a culture of testing and experimentation while driving to a long-term strategy. Monitor demand gen trends and regularly test new programs, tactics, partners, channels, etc to boost customer acquisition.
  • Partner with our content team to optimize paid and owned content distribution and nurture prospects throughout the acquisition funnel. Partner with our creative and product marketing teams to optimize and test creative assets, value propositions, landing pages, and email/ad copy.
  • Partner closely with sales and business development on campaign follow-up, outreach strategies, and ABM initiatives.
  • Forecast, measure, and report on the impact of demand activities on leads, pipeline, and revenue.


    • About You
  • You thrive on owning and beating ambitious goals. We need to double lead and pipeline growth over the next 12 months. Are you up for the challenge?
  • You’re always learning. You fail fast, iterate quickly, and have a history of solving tough problems with innovative solutions.
  • You’re excited about (and have plenty of experience with) product-led growth. We’re champions of the movement and practitioners ourselves. Appcues’ self-serve free trial has helped us land new customers from rapid-growth startups to the Fortune 500.
  • You’re a natural leader. You’ll help establish a culture of experimentation within our marketing team and across the organization. Our team is super collaborative, stacked with talent, and ready to rally behind you.
  • You balance strategic, long-term thinking with a move-fast, get-shit-done style of execution.
  • You’ve got strong analytical and quantitative skills. No doubt, this is a data-driven role.
  • You’ve scaled paid and organic acquisition programs and results at and beyond our stage of business.
  • You have experience managing people, agencies, vendors, and budgets.

jobs.title: Manager, Lifecycle Marketing
jobs.description:
About us

Pomelo Care is a multi-disciplinary team of clinicians, engineers and problem solvers who are passionate about improving care for moms and babies. We are transforming outcomes for pregnant people and babies with evidence-based pregnancy and newborn care at scale. Our technology-driven care platform enables us to engage patients early, conduct individualized risk assessments for poor pregnancy outcomes, and deliver coordinated, personalized virtual care throughout pregnancy, NICU stays, and the first postpartum year. We measure ourselves by reductions in preterm births, NICU admissions, c-sections and maternal mortality; we improve outcomes and reduce healthcare spend.

Role Description

Your North Star: Optimize our patient enrollment funnel to increase our enrollment rate.

In this role, you will execute, and optimize end-to-end, omnichannel marketing strategies to drive patient enrollment and retention. You will be responsible for defining segmentation strategies, building and optimizing patient marketing journeys and campaigns using multivariate A/B tests, and measuring performance. This role is ideal for someone with B2B2C marketing experience who has previously served in roles supporting lifecycle marketing for high growth healthcare start-ups.

Responsibilities
  • Manage end-to-end, multi-channel enrollment campaigns (e.g., e-mail, direct mail, SMS, paid media) developing efficiencies and automations that allow for personalization and improve performance.
  • Define, scope, and prioritize A/B tests to optimize enrollment funnel performance and improve retention.
  • Develop reports and dashboards in collaboration with the Data team to track and measure patient funnel and campaign performance to identify opportunities to increase enrollment rate, decrease time to conversion, and improve retention.
  • Manage marketing implementations for new launches including creating marketing materials and managing the approvals process with partners.
  • Collaborate closely with the Marketing, Customer Success, Outreach, and Clinical teams to ensure we are delivering on contract requirements, the client’s needs, Pomelo’s ability to deliver care, and adjust our marketing campaigns and strategy accordingly.
  • Manage relationships with external agencies and vendors as needed, ensuring timely and high-quality deliverables.
  • Ensure compliance and best practices with CAN-SPAM, TCPA, HIPAA, and other applicable laws.
Who you are
  • 4+ years of experience in B2B2C lifecycle, growth, or email marketing at a high growth startup
  • Strong analytical skills, a sharp attention to detail, and experience running A/B tests to drive performance.
  • Comfortable with ambiguity and thrive in fast paced environments.
  • Creative, scrappy, and willing to wear many hats.
  • Knowledge of marketing automation platforms and CRMs (e.g. Customerio, Salesforce).
Why you should join our team

By joining Pomelo, you will get in on the ground floor of a fast-moving, well-funded, and mission-driven startup where you will have a profound impact on the patients we serve. And you'll learn, grow, be challenged, and have fun with your team while doing it.

We strive to create an environment where employees from all backgrounds are respected. We value working across disciplines, moving fast, data-driven decision making, learning, and always putting the patient first. We also offer:

  • Competitive healthcare benefits
  • Generous equity compensation
  • Unlimited vacation
  • Membership in the First Round Network (a curated and confidential community with events, guides, thousands of Q&A questions, and opportunities for 1-1 mentorship)

At Pomelo, we are committed to hiring the best team to improve outcomes for all mothers and babies, regardless of their background. We need diverse perspectives to reflect the diversity of problems we face and the population we serve. We look to hire people from a variety of backgrounds, including but not limited to race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, disability, and veteran status.

Our salary ranges are based on paying competitively for our company’s size and industry, and are one part of the total compensation package that also includes equity, benefits, and other opportunities at Pomelo Care. In accordance with New York City, Colorado, California, and other applicable laws, Pomelo Care is required to provide a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. Individual pay decisions are ultimately based on a number of factors, including qualifications for the role, experience level, skillset, geography, and balancing internal equity. A reasonable estimate of the current salary range is $105,000-$125,000. We expect most candidates to fall in the middle of the range. We also believe that your personal needs and preferences should be taken into consideration, so we allow some choice between equity and cash.

jobs.title: Generative AI Content Creator
jobs.description:

jobs.title: Marketing Strategist

You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to analyze market trends, identify target audiences, and devise innovative campaigns that resonate with our customers.

jobs.title: Communication Specialist
jobs.description:
Do you enjoy working with different teams to gather insights and share company news? Are you passionate about crafting engaging messages for various channels and building a strong social media strategy? Do you like writing compelling newsletters and blog posts that keep everyone informed?

If you answered yes to these questions, we are sure this position will sound super exciting to you. 🤩

We are looking for a friendly person in love with words and communication to take care of our products: WP Rocket, Imagify, RocketCDN (and maybe more!) 🚀

Keep reading for more details! 📝

Become Our New Communication Specialist!

In your job as a Communication Specialist, you will be communicating across all channels (website, social media, email,...).

In this role, you will report directly to the VP of Marketing and contribute significantly to driving the company’s success by building and growing best-in-class communication.

For this position, it’s essential to be perfectly fluent in English. Since we also communicate in French, it would be a nice plus if you are able to effectively and professionally write in French.

You will join our Marketing team. We work remotely, and ideally you should live in a time zone between GMT+3 to GMT-5. We are so curious to know which new country will be added to our distributed team map! 🌍

What You Will Be Doing:

In your everyday job as a Communication Specialist, you should first enjoy our products! You will write and craft consistent communication to develop brand awareness, visibility, and engagement.


Here is a list describing the tasks involved in this position (do you happen to like making lists? So do we!):

  • You will grow and develop our brands, giving it more character and depth every day so that all customers find it loveable.
  • You will collaborate with the marketing team and other departments to get insights and share news about what’s happening in the company,
  • You will create consistent and desirable messages adapted to each communication channel (ads, emails, landing pages…)
  • You will build and execute a social media strategy to broaden our audience, engage with our community and drive user engagement.
  • You will be in charge of our newsletter, curating content ideas, crafting engaging messages, sending it to our audience, and growing our email list.
  • You will write blog posts about what’s happening internally (yearly review, WordCamps, team’s success…).
  • You will provide communication and social media activity reports and input for improvement.
What Do You Need To Excel at This Job:

Being yourself.

Our team is diverse and composed of people from all over the world. Respect, collaboration, and inclusivity are some of our core values (more on this below). Every day of work is an exciting opportunity to get in touch with fantastic people who will enrich your cultural and professional background.

Proven working experience in social media management and communication.

You have solid experience in social media management and communication (ideally in a start-up, a tech or a major e-commerce company), and a great understanding of marketing processes.

Excellent proficiency in English.

Your English is absolutely perfect. You write with excellent spelling, grammar and proofreading skills, while remaining accessible to a non-native English-speaking audience.

Communication and storytelling skills.

You can communicate openly with people, and modulate your writing tone according to the channel you write for. Your communication is friendly and engaging, even when you write about very technical topics.

Creative thinking and innovation.

You are able to think outside the box, generate innovative ideas, and develop unique content that captures our audience’s attention. Your ability to craft compelling stories and visually engaging posts will set our communication apart and drive our brand forward.

Organization and multitasking skills.

You can juggle different tasks but also ask for help when needed. The team will always be at your side to support you in case of doubt, and to spend happy moments exchanging funny animated GIFs!

Positive attitude, detail and customer-oriented.

You define yourself as a positive and proactive person. You like to experiment and also maintain your actions customer-focused.

Do you want to know three other things we appreciate about our candidates?

  • Previous remote job experience.
    Slack will be your virtual office, where all the life of the company takes place.
  • Knowing the basics of web performance.
    We will train you for this, and we will always have your back, don't worry! But if you already have experience with web performance optimization, let us know. 😉
  • The involvement in the WordPress community.
    We support our teammates to attend and/or speak at WordCamps and volunteer within the community.
